content: the demon hunter i love the movie constantine and so my socks this year are inspired by that movie there is a lot of symbolism in the movie used to defeat demons and so i have used the main symbols as features on my socks the feet instep symbol is called the red king and is used by constantine to draw the angel gabriel from the veil and in the visionary plane which is one of the strongest and powerful symbols i have included the words he said on the soles of the socks to bring this power to life the symbol is in two halves one on the right the other on the left so when you put your feet together you can see the symbol whole the crucifix is part of constantine s gun and a staple symbol in any devil/angel theme and the trinity knot otherwise known as the celtic knot is used to ward off evil spirits in the movie and will feature at the front of the leg materials 2 25 mm needles either dpns or cable 25 to 50g of main colour yarn for each sock 10g of 3 contrasting colours to the main colour chosen stitch markers abbreviations ds double stitch ws wrong side rs right side ssk slip slip knit k2tog knit 2 together k knit p purl sl slip_stitch toe to begin cast on 9 sts on each needle 18 in total i recommend judy s magic cast on round 1 knit 1 round 18 st place a stitch marker if needed round 2 knit 1 knit through the front then the back of the same stitch kfb knit to the 2nd last stitch before the marker knit through the front then the back of the same stitch kfb then knit 1 st repeat for the remaining 9 st now you will have 13 st 4 st increase repeat these 2 rounds until you have the desired amount of sts on your needles for your size foot knitter uses 66 st small size to increase the size add more sts to the cast on knit 13 rounds then begin charts the word charts go on the sole of the sock on the right sock knit 2 at the beginning of each row before you begin chart below chart is knit left to right top down on the left sock begin the chart at the beginning of the row do not need to knit 2 stitches before beginning the chart as was needed with the right sock left chart is knit left to right and top to bottom right sock left sock the top of the foot charts are knit left to right bottom to top if you want the image to face the onlooker this will make them appear upside down to the wearer or knit the opposite way if you want the image to face you there is no border on the chart so the images will line up together
